noun.description: The breeding of specimens of a plant or animal by natural processes from the parent stock.
examples: the propagation of plants by root cuttings

noun.description: The action of widely spreading and promoting an idea, theory, etc.
examples: a life devoted to the propagation of the Catholic faith
the propagation of ideas was important

noun.description: Transmission of motion, light, sound, etc. in a particular direction or through a medium.
examples: the propagation of radio waves through space
